newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Memtec delays hit Florida plant.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Memtec delays hit Florida plant.

text.p: Water filtration company Memtec Ltd said on Thursday the capacity additions at their fluid dynamics manufacturing facility at Deland Florida have been delayed by about five weeks and resulted in a output shortfall.
"In value terms, this is equal to approximately two weeks of the planned annual value of production at the plant," Memtec said.
"This will have a significant but as yet not fully quantified negative effect on the financial performance of the Fluid Dynamics Division for the December financial quarter just completed," it said.

Memtec said it would book a significant one-time profit in the quarter as a consequence of the termination payment received from Gelman Sciences Inc when Gelman withdrew from merger negotiations with Memtec.
"This unrelated transaction will minimise the total profitability effect that might otherwise have been expected," Memtec said.

"When considering Memtec's consolidated position management still believe that the EPS (earnings per share) range in analysts forecasts available to the market for the quarter will approximate the actual result," it said.
Memtec's order intake and backlog remain strong indicating that overall trading conditions remain firm, Memtec said.
It said its December quarter financial performance would be released as planned on January 31.
At 3.00 p.m. (0400 GMT), Memtec shares were 30 cents down at A$36.45.
